sentences.sContent: I’ll have to ask my boss for a day off.
Since I’m my own boss (=  I work for myself, rather than for an employer  ) , my hours are flexible.
sentences.sCn: 我自己当老板，所以我的时间很灵活。

sentences.sContent: ...Chris knows that his boss likes Kim’s work...
...I guess he'd forgotten he used the same excuse when he called his boss from my house...
...He called his boss and said he had to get a new set of tires put on his truck...
...It wasn’t until my boss received Mindsets’ training that she was able to understand how important inclusiveness was to customer service...

...The difference is that the boss of the animal hunting and the head of nut gathering probably told them to “Shut up!” or “No survival for you!” Today’s workers are still demanding control over their time...
...I found this report worth reading and suggest every boss should read it for ideas...

trans.tranOther: the person who employs you or who is in charge of you at work
to tell people to do things, give them orders etc, especially when you have no authority to do it
